content.rendered:
BIS (Bureau Of Indian Standards) MENF

Bureau of Indian Standards: Safeguarding Quality and Safety in India
Get Started

What is the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS)?

The Bureau of the Indian Standards BIS is an Indian government agency responsible for setting, developing and granting the standardisation and quality certification of goods and services in India. BIS is a statutory body arranged under the Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, with the significant responsibility of supporting products that conform to the minimum acceptable standards of quality, safety, and efficiency expected in a product.

Types of BIS Activities

Standardisation: Preparing and setting standard measures for various products to check their quality, safety, and reliability.

Marking and Certification: Offering the facility to obtain BIS certification marks such as ISI mark that certifies the product conforms to the prescribed standards.

Trade Facilitation: Synchronising the standards with the international standards to improve the trade and market access for Indian products..

Training and Consultancy: Providing training courses and consultancy for the stakeholders of the industries so that they can abide by the BIS standards.

How We Can Help You: Service offerings of Certified BIS Mark and BIS Product Certification & Trademark

It can be challenging to go through the requirements for the BIS certification procedure. We can guide you with legal advice to have your products conform to all the regs so that one can get the sealed BIS mark. In the same regard, the trademark services our company offers offer safeguard your brand image, meaning your certified products will be easily noticeable in the market.

Get Your BIS Certification Today!

Get Started
